place.name: LLANGWYLLOG
place.gazetteerText: LLANGWYLIOG, a parish, with a railway station, in the district and county of Anglesey; 3 ¾ miles SSE of Llanerchymedd. Post town, Llangefni, Anglesey. Acres, 2,301. Real property, £2,127. Pop., 207. Houses, 32. The property is divided among a few. Roman coins have been found. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Bangor. Value, £185. Patron, Sir R. B. W. Bulkeley, Bart. The church is dedicated to St. Cwyllog, and is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
